TopicTitle: The 0.25 Waiting Room, now boarding passengers heading to Hypetown

Articles.Content:
We need to re rail the hypetrain!

The HypeTrain's back on the rails, but it's on more than just two...

I still want to know what happened to this:

Kerbal Experience

Recovering Kerbals will now reward your reputation based on where theyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been (and what theyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve done there), and their accomplishments will be stored in persistent Ã¢â‚¬ËœcareerÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ logs for each crewmember.

Listed here: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/content/302-The-0-25-Plan
That's perfect, rthsom.

At first I was hyped up about the destructible KSC and spaceplane+, but after seeing Yargnit playing on the hardest settings... I think the difficulty settings will be the real gamechanger. I've been playing since .16 and while this game has infinite things to do, I'm afraid I've run out of challenges long ago. I think superhard mode, however, will be pretty interesting!

The expense of launchpad repair combined with the temptation to trade funds for science may finally add some budget constraints, too. Especially on the harder settings.

I wonder if they've polished the contracts at all?

I wonder if they've polished the contracts at all?

Doesn't look like it, and I think I saw somewhere that changes regarding contracts could be in .26 or something.
Looks like the minimum setting for the sliders in the difficulty screen is 10%. Here's hoping that matches a setting in the persistent.sfs file so I can actually turn contract science down to 0.

Looks like the minimum setting for the sliders in the difficulty screen is 10%. Here's hoping that matches a setting in the persistent.sfs file so I can actually turn contract science down to 0.

Doesn't that slider also effect the science you get from experiments, samples, etc? It looks like it did in the live streams.

Hi. I was looking yesterday at the first squadtv video, and I saw that in the top right toolbar there was an extra button (or at least looked like that) with the shape of a wrench. I've never seen mods using the toolbar yet, and I always use blizzy toolbar, so could somebody explain what was that? I'm curious

Doesn't that slider also effect the science you get from experiments, samples, etc? It looks like it did in the live streams.

No clue. I thought it was but someone convinced me that the wording on the screen made it likely that it was just contract gains. I skip the live streams so only have what's said here and any YouTube videos to go by, and so I've seen nothing official.

Hi. I was looking yesterday at the first squadtv video, and I saw that in the top right toolbar there was an extra button (or at least looked like that) with the shape of a wrench. I've never seen mods using the toolbar yet, and I always use blizzy toolbar, so could somebody explain what was that? I'm curious

I think it was from a mod, I forget which one.
Anyone else going to run a SandReer mode with save editing to get science and then normal flight with automatic assignment disabled?

The HypeTrain's back on the rails, but it's on more than just two...

http://i.imgur.com/BWyqtDA.jpg

You've made me a very very very happy Kerbal.
Aww, and I was hoping that Danny2462 would have something on offer for the media team. Shame, the destructible buildings are right up his alley.

I still want to know what happened to this:

Listed here: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/content/302-The-0-25-Plan

I'm wondering about this too. This along with difficulty settings was one of the things I was most looking forward to. Of course there's always Final Frontier but that seemed a little buggy to me. No offense to the creator of course, it was a great idea / effort and could have just been my particular save (or my memory failing)

Heh, I just mentioned this in another thread.

MK3 and Kerbal Experience were confirmed to be delayed to 0.26 on a recent Squadcast episode.

*Me playing Civilization III*

I'm bored,

*Gets on Internet Explorer (Don't judge me)*

Huh, I wonder how KSP is doing.

Ah! SpaceplanesPlus is being official, Cool, Now my hate for mods has gone down by 50%

Cool, Administration Strategies! Nice Squad.

Pretty grass texture, Nice.

Hm... What else.

YEAH!!!!

MK3 and Kerbal Experience were confirmed to be delayed to 0.26 on a recent Squadcast episode.

Ah, thanks! Good to know.

Yarg's streaming right now, and his version has the mk2 probe core in it again (mk2 rollercoaster :S )...

Also the brown reaction wheel is now 0.625m.

Have we seen anything yet about whether easter egg buildings are destructible? KSC2 and the island runway don't look much tougher than the space centre facilities. Monoliths might need a much harder hit to break them...

From the livestream:

When will 0.25 be released, Nightbot?

[REDACTED]

From the livestream:

When will 0.25 be released, Nightbot?

[REDACTED]

TELL ME YOUR SECREEETS!! xD

*still staring at SteamDB*

Hmm, there was no experimentals updates yesterday, yet Max said on squadcast that Harvester has been working weekends for months now...

Ok this probably means nothing.
I walk around with 50$ at all times. If the hype station was a physical location and not an online one, I would currently be handing the ticket master my wallet and boarding.
Hype away and dont forget to check out everyone elses vids in the media group!!!
